DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Myocardial Infarction Initial Diagnosis Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date of the initial diagnosis of a myocardial infaction, gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area) or fatal coronary heart disease (CHD).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Myocardial Infarction Initial Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the initial diagnosis of a myocardial infaction, gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area) or fatal coronary heart disease (CHD).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.:occurring at the beginning.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
